prompt: Photorealistic image: An experienced art appraiser, mid-50s, wearing professional attire and white gloves, carefully examines a large, ornate 18th-century oil painting resting on a sturdy wooden easel. The scene is set in a well-lit, quiet study or gallery space. Soft, natural light streams from a large window to the left, illuminating dust motes in the air and highlighting the texture of the canvas and the appraiser's focused expression. Composition follows the rule of thirds, with the appraiser and easel on the right two-thirds, leaving the left third showing more of the room's background with bookshelves. Eye-level shot, cinematic lighting, high detail. --ar 16:9
name: art-appraisal-image-1.png

prompt: Close-up, macro photography style: An overhead shot focusing on the hands of an art appraiser wearing cotton gloves, using a handheld loupe magnifier to inspect the signature and brushstrokes on the corner of an impressionist painting. The texture of the canvas, the aged varnish, and the intricate detail of the signature are sharply in focus. The background is softly blurred (shallow depth of field), hinting at other appraisal tools like a small flashlight and notepad on a wooden table. Lighting is focused and bright on the area under inspection. Professional, meticulous atmosphere. --ar 16:9
name: art-appraisal-image-2.png

prompt: Wide-angle, eye-level shot: An art appraiser, holding a digital tablet displaying reference images, stands thoughtfully in a spacious, modern living room assessing a diverse private art collection. Various pieces are visible â€“ a contemporary sculpture on a pedestal near the foreground, abstract paintings on the wall, and perhaps a glimpse of antique furniture. The appraiser is positioned slightly off-center, looking towards the main wall display. Bright, ambient interior lighting. The image conveys the scope and context of appraising an entire collection within a high-end residential setting. Photorealistic, clean aesthetic. --ar 16:9
name: art-appraisal-image-3.png

prompt: Photorealistic scene: A dedicated art research workspace. Focus on a polished wooden desk cluttered with essential appraisal tools: open, heavy art history reference books and auction catalogues, a laptop displaying an art database website (like FindArtInfo or similar), a magnifying lamp casting a warm pool of light, calipers, and handwritten notes. Perhaps a hand is visible, pointing at a detail in a book. The background is slightly out of focus, suggesting more bookshelves or archive boxes. Warm, focused lighting emphasizes the scholarly aspect of appraisal. Composition balances the laptop screen, books, and tools across the landscape frame. --ar 16:9
name: art-appraisal-image-4.png

prompt: Medium shot capturing interaction: An art appraiser, professionally dressed, sits across a table from a client (client partially visible or seen from behind, maintaining focus on the appraiser). The appraiser is gesturing towards a formal, bound appraisal document laid open on the table between them, explaining its contents. A framed artwork, the subject of the appraisal, might be leaning against the wall in the background or partially visible on the table. Setting is a clean, professional office environment. Lighting is soft and even, fostering a sense of trust and expertise. Focus on the appraiser's engaging expression and the detailed report. --ar 16:9
name: art-appraisal-image-5.png
